We study the study, dignified faces of twelve men, flanki man...six to a side...their features betraying substantiv differences...They are red, black, yellow, white...indeed variation...

Even the humble attempt at quelling the voices cannot den their measure of gratitude...the cups are raised and the joins in...

dialogues.speaker: ADAMA
dialogues.text: I didn't hear you come in. I was just gathering a few rem You want this likeness of you and Zac? Skyler snaps back, his mood hardening against the hurt

dialogues.speaker: SKYLER
dialogues.text: No... (beat) Look, there are crowds coming. They probably saw our ship Adama stiffens

dialogues.speaker: ADAMA
dialogues.text: I'll be a few more minutes Skyler turns to leave, then seems to soften, turning back

dialogues.speaker: SKYLER
dialogues.text: Maybe she wasn't here. Maybe... The Commander looks at Skyler with finality.

dialogues.speaker: ADAMA
dialogues.text: She was here... Skyler nods and slowly withdraws.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE THE DWELLING
dialogues.text: have approached to within fifty yards of the sleek fighte voices are pitched and angular as they stride down the ge towards Skyler, who moves out to meet them, warily gaugin hostile cries.

dialogues.speaker: SANDELL
dialogues.text: Where are they? Where're the rest of your fancy fliers?

dialogues.speaker: LOBE
dialogues.text: Where were you, lad, when they were killing everyone in s were you doing, boy? As they close the gap to within a few feet of Skyler and taking him apart, a woman's voice calls out

dialogues.speaker: LYRA
dialogues.text: Wait! For a moment, there is hesitation. The mob parts as Lyra forward, holding a small boy by the hand.

dialogues.speaker: LYRA
dialogues.text: Let him talk. She continues on out until she is face-to-face with Skyle

dialogues.speaker: LYRA
dialogues.text: Before they do what they will with you, I'd like to know were. Where were all of you? We waited...we watched and p you never came... Skyler looks down at the small, innocent face looking up Lyra, a child with dirt and confusion in his innocent eye

dialogues.speaker: SKYLER
dialogues.text: Most of us are dead. The crowd breaks into an undertone of awe...

dialogues.speaker: SKYLER
dialogues.text: The fleet is all but destroyed. The crowd breaks into cries of despair and anguish

dialogues.speaker: LYRA
dialogues.text: But you are here...where did you come from?

dialogues.speaker: SKYLER
dialogues.text: The battlestar Galactica

dialogues.speaker: LYRA
dialogues.text: Survived...

dialogues.speaker: SKYLER
dialogues.text: Yes...

dialogues.speaker: LYRA
dialogues.text: And what of the President and the Council of the Twelve.. other colonies. Surely we can fight back. We have the wil long last, after hundreds of years, we are united...all t colonies. They cannot possibly defeat our combined streng A voice from offstage commands their attention

dialogues.speaker: ADAMA
dialogues.text: We became as one too late. The group is stunned to find so imperious a figure as one Council of the Twelve amongst them.

dialogues.speaker: LYRA
dialogues.text: Commander Adama...

dialogues.speaker: LYRA
dialogues.text: Miss Lyra.

dialogues.speaker: ADAMA
dialogues.text: Then it's true. We are defeated...doomed. Skyler and the Commander exchange looks. The little boy, up at Skyler admiringly

dialogues.speaker: BOXEY
dialogues.text: Can I ride in your ship, Mister? Skyler bends down and picks him up. Skyler looks at the l Adama pointedly.

dialogues.speaker: SKYLER
dialogues.text: Fighter ships are no place for boys...

dialogues.speaker: LYRA
dialogues.text: They're going to have to be if our people are going to su Adama turns and walks off to the edge of the bluff overlo burning cities beyond. Lyra moves up behind him, beside S is carrying the young child.

dialogues.speaker: LYRA
dialogues.text: We are going to fight back...we can't simply give up. The Commander seems deep in thought as he looks out over Then he turns and looks past Lyra and Skyler...past the b

dialogues.speaker: ADAMA
dialogues.text: Yes, we are going to fight back. A cry of bravado goes up from the torch-bearing mob...cri satisfaction, of frustration, of vented anger

dialogues.speaker: ADAMA
dialogues.text: But not here...not now...not in the colonies...not even i system. Let the word go forth to every man, woman and chi survived this infamy. Tell them to set sail at once in ev vehicle that will carry them...

dialogues.speaker: SKYLER
dialogues.text: There isn't time to arrange provision, Father. The Cylons sending landing parties to eradicate the survivors. If we in our remaining fighters...

dialogues.speaker: ADAMA
dialogues.text: No. There are too many of them and too few of us. There i fight, and a time to withdraw...to fight another day.

dialogues.speaker: SKYLER
dialogues.text: But there is no way to board the entire population on the And we have no troop carriers, nothing that can make ligh

dialogues.speaker: ADAMA
dialogues.text: We'll use what we do have. Every inner-galactic passenger freighter, taxi...even inner colony buses...air taxis...a that will carry our people into the stars...

dialogues.speaker: LYRA
dialogues.text: And when they have gathered in the stars...?

dialogues.speaker: ADAMA
dialogues.text: We will lead them...and protect them...until they are str The group facing the Commander turn, exchanging curious l they are in the presence of a madman or a savior...

dialogues.speaker: A PLANET IN FLAMES
dialogues.text: with countless assorted vehicles rising from it, leaving

dialogues.speaker: ADAMA'S VOICE
dialogues.text: And the word went forth to every outpost of human existen came...The Aeries from Aeriana...

dialogues.speaker: ON ANOTHER DISSIMILAR PLANET
dialogues.text: with more ships rising into the stars

dialogues.speaker: ADAMA'S VOICE
dialogues.text: The Gemons from the planet Gemini...

dialogues.speaker: ON ANOTHER PLANET
dialogues.text: with multiple moons

dialogues.speaker: ADAMA'S VOICE
dialogues.text: The Virgos from Virgon...The Scorpios, the Picons...and t Sagitarians...

dialogues.speaker: ON THE RAG TAG FLEET
dialogues.text: assembling among the stars. As they move by camera, we se of every description, color and text. A bulbous vessel, b signet, "TRANS-STELLAR SPACE SERVICE"...an immense vehicl lettering "GEMINI FREIGHT"...a small space tram, "TAURON a long-range passenger liner with lettering and initials non-descript, unfamiliar text, dominated by three large s tail structure...as far as the eye could perceive, a flee of every assortment, size and shape...

dialogues.speaker: ADAMA'S VOICE
dialogues.text: In all, two hundred and twenty ships representing every c and creed in the star system. The human race might have o chance, but it would first have to survive the Alliance.. and the unknown dark and sinister threats that would lie

dialogues.speaker: ON A CYLON BASE SHIP
dialogues.text: hovering over Caprica

dialogues.speaker: TWO CYLON WARSHIPS
dialogues.text: approach the Cylon mother ship

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE INNER CHAMBER
dialogues.text: a side door opens and two Cylon warriors cross towards th pedestal with a human between them. He is Baltar. One of sentries beside Baltar speaks.

dialogues.speaker: SENTRY
dialogues.text: At your command.

dialogues.speaker: LEADER
dialogues.text: Welcome, Baltar. You have done well. Baltar looks as if he is about to attack the Leader...obv unwise move

dialogues.speaker: BALTAR
dialogues.text: I have done well...What have you done? What of our bargai was to be spared!

dialogues.speaker: LEADER
dialogues.text: The bargain was altered.

dialogues.speaker: BALTAR
dialogues.text: How can you change one side of a bargain?

dialogues.speaker: LEADER
dialogues.text: But there is no other side. You have missed the entire po war. Baltar's resolve, his anger, is replaced by a creeping co he has erred in his evaluation of the man before him.

dialogues.speaker: BALTAR
dialogues.text: I don't know what you mean.

dialogues.speaker: LEADER
dialogues.text: I mean, there could be no dominion over the species so lo remained a power within the Universe. It was man or the A There could be no compromise.

dialogues.speaker: BALTAR
dialogues.text: But you have what you want...the threat no longer exists. my end of the bargain. My dominion was to be spared.

dialogues.speaker: LEADER
dialogues.text: There can be only one dominion...one power... one authori must be no exceptions.

dialogues.speaker: BALTAR
dialogues.text: But I have no ambitions against you!

dialogues.speaker: LEADER
dialogues.text: Could you think me so foolish as to trust a man who would race destroyed?

dialogues.speaker: BALTAR
dialogues.text: Not destroyed, subjugated...under me.

dialogues.speaker: LEADER
dialogues.text: There can be no survivors. So long as one human remains a Alliance is threatened.

dialogues.speaker: BALTAR
dialogues.text: Surely you don't mean me?

dialogues.speaker: LEADER
dialogues.text: We thank you for your help, Baltar. Your time is at an en The Leader nods and the two ominous sentries on either si lift him from the floor, one on each arm, and begin to ta

dialogues.speaker: BALTAR
dialogues.text: No...you can't...you still need me...

dialogues.speaker: LEADER
dialogues.text: Send the flight leader in.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE DOOR
dialogues.text: A sentry enters and stands aside as the flight leader ent directly to the center of the room.

dialogues.speaker: FLIGHT LEADER
dialogues.text: At your command...

dialogues.speaker: LEADER
dialogues.text: Report on the final assault on the human colonies.

dialogues.speaker: FLIGHT LEADER
dialogues.text: The ships all report similar circumstances. The initial a effective, there were no survivors.

dialogues.speaker: LEADER
dialogues.text: (incredulously) No survivors!!! On any of the twelve colonies?

dialogues.speaker: FLIGHT LEADER
dialogues.text: That is correct, Imperious Leader. Slowly push into the Imperious Leader's knowing gaze...

dialogues.speaker: ON THE RAG TAG FLEET
dialogues.text: Countless ships of every description scattered across the the lone survivor of the Colonial Fleet. We slowly push i lead vehicle and see its name

dialogues.speaker: IN A LARGE COUNCIL CHAMBER
dialogues.text: Commander Adama stands before a large, seated gathering, to his back

dialogues.speaker: ADAMA
dialogues.text: Long, long ago...whether thousand or millions of year is unimportant...our recorded history tells us that we desce mother civilization, a race that set out into the univers establish colonies. Those of us here now represent every surviving colony, save one. A sister world far out in the only remembered to us through ancient writings. It is my seek out that remaining colony, that last outpost of huma universe. A civilization like our own, to ask their help rebuilding...and perhaps, to warn them of an evil Allianc intention to eradicate all mankind.

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT STARBUCK
dialogues.text: rises to his feet. All around him are other fighter pilot

dialogues.speaker: ADAMA
dialogues.text: Lieutenant Starbuck, you have a question?

dialogues.speaker: STARBUCK
dialogues.text: Yes, sir. If we're talking about the same colony, I remem about it in ancient mythology. I don't think anybody even it is, and if our own ship is any indication, we barely h fuel to get out of this galaxy. Starbuck sits as a surge of agreement sweeps through the

dialogues.speaker: ADAMA
dialogues.text: A very good point. It will be our plan to find a fuel sou extended provisions before we leave the star system. Colonel Tigh rises to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: TIGH
dialogues.text: Commander, I feel I speak for the vast majority when I sa hardly a fleet of sturdy, well-equipped soldiers up to ba universe. Most of these people barely got away with their They're emotionally and physically unprepared for the kin you propose. The crowd seems to agree as Skyler is now on his feet, as

dialogues.speaker: SKYLER
dialogues.text: And less than a third of the ships we're escorting can ma speed. It could take us generations to find this colony.

dialogues.speaker: ADAMA
dialogues.text: And we'll find it because we have no choice. If we stay i system, the Alliance will find us. We'll travel only as f slowest ship. We'll be only as strong as our weakest brot the only surviving battlestar, but the combined pilots th ours and the other ships are the best in all the universe up to the task of protecting each and every one of you.

dialogues.speaker: LYRA
dialogues.text: rises to her feet. We recognize her as the newswoman from

dialogues.speaker: LYRA
dialogues.text: Commander Adama...forgive the void in my education, but s mythology was never my best subject. This thirteenth colo this other world...where is it? What is it called? Adama takes a long pause as he scans the audience, then t starfield and gazes at it like a man searching the horizo glimpse of a sail beyond a sea.

dialogues.speaker: ADAMA
dialogues.text: I cannot tell you that I know precisely where it is...but beyond this star system in a galaxy like our own. As for name... Adama looks back to the expectant throng...

dialogues.speaker: ADAMA
dialogues.text: It is called Earth. A long beat as excitement builds through the congregation

dialogues.speaker: ON THE GALACTICA
dialogues.text: maneuvering ahead of the rag tag fleet

dialogues.speaker: IN THE CONFERENCE ROOM
dialogues.text: Adama stands before a translucent starmap, addressing a c elders

dialogues.speaker: ADAMA
dialogues.text: Our course, while indirect and arduous, has successfully to the outermost reaches of the star system without encou Cylon patrols. If we can hold out for another eight or ni we can reach the planet Carillon. Adama turns and moves back to face the main body

dialogues.speaker: ADAMA
dialogues.text: There, hopefully we can find fuel, water, and prepare fre of food...

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: Hopefully? My dear Commander, there is not one amongst us grateful beyond words for your vision and resourcefulness us all from certain death. Are we now to throw it all awa Anton rises

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: As of this moment, we face a crisis no less lethal than t machine. I would rather see my loved ones extinguished in flash of a Cylon cannon than drift in fuelless vehicles w starvation, dehydration, and suffocation agonize us one b

dialogues.speaker: ADAMA
dialogues.text: Anton, it was hardly possible to adequately prepare ourse journey we've had to undertake. We had to leave. We had n Anton moves to the map.

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: But we have a choice now. We can stop here on Borallus. W everything we need is here...food, water, fuel... There are waves of approval throughout the room

dialogues.speaker: ADAMA
dialogues.text: And undoubtedly a Cylon task force. A murmur races through the room

dialogues.speaker: ADAMA
dialogues.text: It is the most logical place for us to stop. Precisely wh it would be fatal to do so.

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: Possibly fatal. Is it not surely fatal to continue toward Colonel Tigh rises

dialogues.speaker: TIGH
dialogues.text: Commander...the situation has reached crisis levels. Rati already been cut by two-thirds. How much more can we cons

dialogues.speaker: ADAMA
dialogues.text: As much as we have to, to reach Carillon. It is our only

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: The Cylons will be looking even unto those far reaches.

dialogues.speaker: ADAMA
dialogues.text: There is a path here, through the Nova of Madagon. Not pa a savings of some two centons in reaching Carillon. A gasp is heard throughout the council as Adama points to through the starfield.

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: Commander, while I may not be a military expert, even I k Cylons avoid patrolling that area by mining it to make pa impossible.

dialogues.speaker: ADAMA
dialogues.text: Not impossible. We will do it. We have no other choice.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE BODY OF ELDERS
dialogues.text: Their faces are grim

dialogues.speaker: ON A CYLON BASE SHIP
dialogues.text: hanging ominously in the sky

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE INNER CHAMBER
dialogues.text: two Cylon Centurians enter with Baltar between them. Balt different man than the one who strode arrogantly before t one.

dialogues.speaker: CENTURIAN
dialogues.text: By your command...

dialogues.speaker: LEADER
dialogues.text: The people of Cylon wish to offer you an opportunity to s Baltar searches for deception in the Leader's words, but resigned to death to challenge the unexpected words.

dialogues.speaker: BALTAR
dialogues.text: To serve...?

dialogues.speaker: LEADER
dialogues.text: It appears that a small band of refugee humans eluded the Baltar seems to stand a little taller

dialogues.speaker: BALTAR
dialogues.text: I tried to forewarn you... The Centurians hurl Baltar to the flood and hold staffs a back of his head.

dialogues.speaker: LEADER
dialogues.text: I offer you life, and you question my judgment? Dangerous

dialogues.speaker: BALTAR
dialogues.text: raises his head slightly

dialogues.speaker: BALTAR
dialogues.text: Kill me... The Imperious Leader stares at Baltar. The Centurians wai sign to kill him.

dialogues.speaker: LEADER
dialogues.text: Let him rise The Centurians remove their staffs. Baltar climbs to his

dialogues.speaker: LEADER
dialogues.text: I sense a bargain...

dialogues.speaker: BALTAR
dialogues.text: We bargained before and it left me a dead man. This time my reward before I serve you.

dialogues.speaker: LEADER
dialogues.text: The entire Alliance serves me. Why do I need you?

dialogues.speaker: BALTAR
dialogues.text: Why do you spare me? Because you fear man. You do not und When your forces had taken and put the entire nation of T slavery, man was there to break the chains. When you chos the people of Gaelon, man was there to make the Galics st them seek their own destiny. The Cylon is content to serv born to lead. But I can succeed where you have failed.

dialogues.speaker: LEADER
dialogues.text: What is your bargain?

dialogues.speaker: BALTAR
dialogues.text: When I find the survivors of the colonies...they are mine

dialogues.speaker: LEADER
dialogues.text: And how to you propose to protect this bargain?

dialogues.speaker: BALTAR
dialogues.text: There are those who will follow me...away from your influ from your interests...

dialogues.speaker: LEADER
dialogues.text: All the stars interest me...

dialogues.speaker: BALTAR
dialogues.text: You can have no reign on tyranny. There is room for all..

dialogues.speaker: LEADER
dialogues.text: You appear as a man, but you think like a Cylon.

dialogues.speaker: BALTAR
dialogues.text: The better to serve you, while serving myself.

dialogues.speaker: LEADER
dialogues.text: You will need Centurians.

dialogues.speaker: BALTAR
dialogues.text: Two will be adequate.

dialogues.speaker: LEADER
dialogues.text: Only two...?? Baltar looks from the Centurian on his left to the Centur right

dialogues.speaker: BALTAR
dialogues.text: These two...

dialogues.speaker: LEADER
dialogues.text: Your arrogance will destroy you.

dialogues.speaker: BALTAR
dialogues.text: I would rather die by my own hand, than yours.

dialogues.speaker: LEADER
dialogues.text: So be it...they are yours... Baltar smiles, nods and turns...

dialogues.speaker: BALTAR
dialogues.text: Come along, boys... As Baltar moves off, the Centurians stand stoically await instructions from the Imperious Leader

dialogues.speaker: LEADER
dialogues.text: Go with him...Serve me!!

dialogues.speaker: CENTURIAN
dialogues.text: By your order... They turn and move off as we close into a very troubled I Leader

dialogues.speaker: ON THE RAG TAG FLEET
dialogues.text: sailing through the sky at a slow pace

dialogues.speaker: ON AN ANTIQUATED VEHICLE
dialogues.text: pushing in to establish the lettering on its side...

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE AN ENGINE AREA
dialogues.text: Skyler crawls out from an access area beneath some mechan is hands and face soiled as his Captain markings on his s the only indications of military rank. He turns to a tool away some instruments, taking us to an older man...

dialogues.speaker: JENSING
dialogues.text: I understand two other ships have already broken down...

dialogues.speaker: SKYLER
dialogues.text: And twenty-two have run out of fuel. Skyler closes his tool his and rises...looking grim

dialogues.speaker: JENSING
dialogues.text: It's serious? Skyler looks at the man whose face bears the emotional sc many recent disasters

dialogues.speaker: SKYLER
dialogues.text: Until we stop for materials or find minerals to make our can't repair it...and you'll never be able to keep up wit like it is.

dialogues.speaker: JENSING
dialogues.text: But what will we do...?

dialogues.speaker: SKYLER
dialogues.text: We'll have to transfer everyone off of this ship to one o How many people on board? A beautiful young lady enters

dialogues.speaker: LYRA
dialogues.text: Twenty-nine... Skyler turns and smiles

dialogues.speaker: SKYLER
dialogues.text: Well, a celebrity. I would have thought you could have pu space on one of the plush passenger liners.

dialogues.speaker: LYRA
dialogues.text: I have no interest in pulling space. This ship was assign

dialogues.speaker: JENSING
dialogues.text: She's being charitable. We asked her if she'd come with u she could help us with the little boy.

dialogues.speaker: SKYLER
dialogues.text: Little boy?

dialogues.speaker: LYRA
dialogues.text: You remember the child found in the bombing? The Jensings same module as Boxey's parents who were killed in the fir

dialogues.speaker: JENSING
dialogues.text: He doesn't sleep and he doesn't eat...even emergency rati Lyra is the only one he'll even talk to.

dialogues.speaker: LYRA
dialogues.text: That's about all I can get him to do. He lost a little da apparently meant everything to him. I thought you might h

dialogues.speaker: SKYLER
dialogues.text: If he won't eat for you, I don't know what I can do.

dialogues.speaker: LYRA
dialogues.text: He seemed to spark a little when you picked him up on Cap the feeling you were good with children.

dialogues.speaker: SKYLER
dialogues.text: (introspectively) I grew up with a kid brother...

dialogues.speaker: IN A NARROW COMPANIONWAY
dialogues.text: off of which countless cubicles have been formed as livin the hold of this cargo vessel. Skyler looks into the face of the refugees occupying the rooms which are open, parti and in a few cases, entirely curtained off with makeshift They arrive at a room which is draped shut. There is only light on inside. Skyler looks at Lyra. She gestures insid reaches into his back pocket and withdraws his military c scrambled eggs and insignia of the Colonial Warriors. He

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE A TINY CUBICLE
dialogues.text: Spartan in its furnishings, the night light illuminates t young boy, who lies staring at the ceiling...wide awake

dialogues.speaker: SKYLER
dialogues.text: Excuse me...I hope I'm not interrupting anything... Boxey's eyes widen

dialogues.speaker: SKYLER
dialogues.text: I'm in charge of finding young men to try out as future f pilots. Your name is Boxey, correct?

dialogues.speaker: BOXEY
dialogues.text: Uh-huh... Skyler nods and moves to the bed and crouches beside it

dialogues.speaker: SKYLER
dialogues.text: Good. I've been looking all over for you. You should have with the Commander. You know we're very short on pilots..

dialogues.speaker: BOXEY
dialogues.text: I'm too little to be a pilot...

dialogues.speaker: SKYLER
dialogues.text: Oh sure, right now, but how long do you think it takes to full Colonial Warrior?

dialogues.speaker: BOXEY
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: SKYLER
dialogues.text: You have to start when you're very small, or you won't ge you have gray hair. Boxey lifts his head to see what Skyler is pointing to on shoulders. The young lad's eyes show their first glimmer as they see Captain's emblems.

dialogues.speaker: SKYLER
dialogues.text: You like them? Then as quickly as the interest appeared, it vanishes and withdraws to his pillow

dialogues.speaker: BOXEY
dialogues.text: I want Muffit...

dialogues.speaker: SKYLER
dialogues.text: Well, I don't know. There isn't much room for a daggit in plane.

dialogues.speaker: BOXEY
dialogues.text: He's gone. He ran away.

dialogues.speaker: SKYLER
dialogues.text: Oh? Well, maybe we can find one of Muffit's friends?

dialogues.speaker: BOXEY
dialogues.text: There are no daggits...I asked... Skyler steals a helpless look at Lyra, who looks back, bo appreciatively and sympathetically.

dialogues.speaker: SKYLER
dialogues.text: Well, I'll tell you what... Skyler removes an emblem from his shoulder and places it night clothes

dialogues.speaker: SKYLER
dialogues.text: As Colonial Warrior First Level, you are entitled to the that comes along Skyler rises and starts out of the room, then hesitates a

dialogues.speaker: SKYLER
dialogues.text: But only on the condition that you get your rest, eat all primaries, and stop chasing girls. Good night, Officer... Skyler salutes and exits with Lyra. Behind them, Boxey st at the emblem on his pajamas. He clutches it in his hand at the darkened ceiling as we move to see the far off loo windows the confused world of a six year old boy.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE CORRIDOR
dialogues.text: Skyler waits as Lyra moves up to him

dialogues.speaker: LYRA
dialogues.text: Thank you. I was right; you are good with kids. You and y must be very close. Skyler steps away

dialogues.speaker: SKYLER
dialogues.text: We were.

dialogues.speaker: LYRA
dialogues.text: I'm sorry! The war?

dialogues.speaker: SKYLER
dialogues.text: I suppose...

dialogues.speaker: LYRA
dialogues.text: Look, if you'd rather not involve yourself...

dialogues.speaker: SKYLER
dialogues.text: (interrupting) Don't be silly. What's a Warrior to do after he's lost th win a few of the little ones...

dialogues.speaker: LYRA
dialogues.text: That's not a little one in their, Captain. You win that o accomplished something.

dialogues.speaker: ON A LARGE SHIP WITH THREE GIANT PODS
dialogues.text: The livery ship. Three large circular compartments, conne narrow metal corridors. Skyler walks with Starbuck down a

dialogues.speaker: STARBUCK
dialogues.text: I don't think I can help you, Skyler. Other than fixing t servos on this livery machine, the only thing I know abou which includes daggits, is that they've run out of food t Let me show you... They have entered one of the large circular pods, taking of animals all facing into a central feeding device. The in pairs, each pair representing a different species. Sta Skyler to one of the stalls where we find two unicorns, o its side.

dialogues.speaker: SKYLER
dialogues.text: How long has he been like that?

dialogues.speaker: STARBUCK
dialogues.text: He collapsed last night just after I was brought on board unicorns are very monogamous. His lady's in foal. They th been letting her have his share of the food ration. If we stopped at Borallus... Skyler storms away

dialogues.speaker: SKYLER
dialogues.text: We couldn't stop. The Cylons would have been there...wait

dialogues.speaker: STARBUCK
dialogues.text: Well, when these animals are gone, they're gone. We'll ju accept the fact that generations will grow up without eve seen a unicorn... or a tagon...or a...

dialogues.speaker: SKYLER
dialogues.text: There wouldn't have been any generations of anything if w I would have made the same decision as my father. Starbuck moves after Skyler

dialogues.speaker: STARBUCK
dialogues.text: Okay...okay...it's just rough to have to watch them slip a time...

dialogues.speaker: SKYLER
dialogues.text: I'll tell you what's rough...We've got a little boy in th condition. Are you sure no one brought any daggits along this whole fleet?

dialogues.speaker: STARBUCK
dialogues.text: No. We're both out of luck...I already checked.

dialogues.speaker: SKYLER
dialogues.text: Both out of luck! You checked for daggits? Why?

dialogues.speaker: STARBUCK
dialogues.text: Daggit racing...

dialogues.speaker: SKYLER
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: STARBUCK
dialogues.text: What's one of the most awful things that can happen to pe long voyage?

dialogues.speaker: SKYLER
